ygData.subject: RE: Charm story and tactics (was RE: SoW vs. Accelerand o vs. giants & charm)
ygData.msgSnippet: I managed to find two cyclops in West Karana (Froon and Choon) over the weekend.  It worked great, unfortunately I charmed the loser and had to run to zone,
ygData.messageBody:
I managed to find two cyclops in West Karana (Froon and Choon) over the
weekend. It worked great, unfortunately I charmed the loser and had to run
to zone, lol. I went back and tried again after Froon respawned and got
killed this time when they both got on top of me due to lag and pounded me
into a bloody stain in grass.

If you want to see a funny EQ Easter Egg, go charm a Griffawn in East Karana
and command it to sit.

Rokenn Swiftsong - Karana server
Master Craftsmen of Societus Argenti

>From: kim@...
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: "'eqbards@onelist.com'" <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Subject: RE: [eqbards] Charm story and tactics (was RE: SoW vs. Accelerand
>o vs. giants & charm)
>Date: Thu, 9 Sep 1999 14:26:32 -0400 (EDT)
>
>From: kim@...
>
>On Thu, 9 Sep 1999, Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas) wrote:
> >
> > charm hehe). well next two tries i killed 4 SGs without losing any
>health.
> > its all playing selo's in between charms and timing your recharming. i
>
>Yeah. The problem now is actually finding two like-level mobs
>to play charm tricks with, and managing to keep them far
>enough from other people so that they don't decide to attack
>because they can't find anything else to fight. (For some
>reason most people don't seem to understand that if two mobs
>are fighting each other, then someone is causing it. They
>don't see a player fighting them so they think the mobs are
>free.)
>
>It doesn't seem to be a problem yet on the younger shards (I
>saw lots of giants last night on Tunare), but it's painfully
>evident on the older ones. I don't think I've seen two giants
>at once (except ice giants) in the entire last month on
>Karana. And when we did try fighting ice giants, the kill
>stealers descended like flies to sh!t within a half hour.
>
>--
>John H. Kim
>kim@...
>
>
